title: TC001-Order Creation with Manual Input
description: Verify that a user can manually create an order, add attachments, notes, generate a unique tracking ID, and commit the order to inventory successfully.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Orders' to navigate to Orders Management page
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Orders' link to navigate to Orders Management page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Create New Order' button
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Create New Order' button
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Order Creation Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The order creation process did not complete successfully as per the test plan. The expected confirmation message "Order Creation Successful" was not found on the page.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-Order Import with Bulk Upload
description: Verify bulk import of orders from file works correctly and all orders are created with attachments and tracking IDs.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the Orders link to navigate to Orders Management page
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Orders link in the sidebar to go to Orders Management page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Locate and click the bulk import option/button to start the import process
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the bulk import option/button to start bulk import of orders
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try clicking the button with index 7 labeled 'MF' which might be the bulk import or related option
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the button labeled 'MF' which might be the bulk import or related option
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Close the 'Settings' modal to return to Orders Management page and look for the bulk import option again
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Close button on the Settings modal to close it and return to Orders Management page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[4]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Look for a button or element that could represent the bulk import option, such as the button with index 13 labeled 'Extract All (Workbook)' or other buttons near the top of the page
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Extract All (Workbook)' button to check if it leads to bulk import or export options
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/header/div[3]/div[2]/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Look for a button or menu to upload a file for bulk import of orders. Try clicking button with index 6 which is unlabeled but near other action buttons.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on unlabeled button near top action buttons to check if it opens bulk import dialog
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Bulk Import Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Bulk import of orders did not complete successfully. All orders may not have been created with attachments and tracking IDs as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Main Sheet Part Lifecycle Status Transition
description: Verify parts progress through lifecycle stages Pending → Arrived → Available → Call List with auto-move workflow triggering when conditions are met.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Main Sheet' to open the module
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Main Sheet' link to open the Main Sheet module
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to find and click any button that might open a form or modal to add a new part, or refresh the page to reload UI elements.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the first visible button to check if it opens add part form or modal
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Refresh Page button to reload UI elements
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/header/div[3]/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to locate any button or icon that might open the add part form or modal, especially buttons around indexes 15-26 which seem clustered and might relate to part actions.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click button at index 15 to check if it opens add part form or modal
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div/div/div/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # If no form opened, click button at index 16 as alternative to open add part form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div/div/div/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Part Status Updated Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test plan execution has failed to verify parts progress through lifecycle stages Pending → Arrived → Available → Call List with auto-move workflow triggering when conditions are met.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Locking Mechanism on Main Sheet to Prevent Concurrent Edits
description: Verify that when one user locks a part record for editing, other users cannot modify it until the lock is released.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:

title: TC015-Error Handling - Client-Side Error Boundaries
description: Verify that client-side errors are caught by error boundaries and rendered with graceful fallback UI without breaking the user experience.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Induce a client-side error by forcing a component to throw an exception.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Call' navigation to go to a page where we might induce a client-side error.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[4]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Client-side error successfully caught by error boundary').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The error boundary did not catch the client-side error or the fallback UI with a user-friendly message was not displayed, indicating a break in user experience.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

description: Measure interaction response times across modules ensuring that UI response times remain under 100ms for all typical user operations.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on Orders module to perform user action and measure response time
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Orders module to perform user action and measure response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on Main Sheet module to perform user action and measure response time
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Main Sheet module to perform user action and measure response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on Call module to perform user action and measure response time
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Call module to perform user action and measure response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[4]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on Booking module to perform user action and measure UI response time
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Booking module to perform user action and measure UI response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[5]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Perform sample user interactions on the Booking module (e.g., clicking a row, toggling a checkbox) and measure UI response time to confirm it is under 100ms.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on a checkbox in the first row to trigger UI update and measure response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[3]/div/div/div[3]/div/div[2]/div[3]/div/div/div/div/div/div/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on a checkbox in the second row to trigger UI update and measure response time
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[3]/div/div/div[3]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/div/div/div[7]/div[3]/div/span').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Orders').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Main Sheet').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Call').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Booking').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=kokokokoko').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Captur II').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Order Confirm').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC017-User Training Efficiency - Task Completion Within 3 Clicks
description: Validate that 90% of common user tasks can be completed within three clicks, ensuring ease of usage and training efficiency.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Orders' to start the task of creating an order and track clicks
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Orders' to start creating an order task
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/nav/ul/li[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the button to create a new order and count clicks
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the button to create a new order
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Task Completion Exceeds Three Clicks').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Less than 90% of common user tasks can be completed within three clicks, violating ease of usage and training efficiency requirement.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
